FuncDef: The display super-vlan command displays information about super VLAN entries.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the VLAN ID of a super VLAN.
When multiple VLANs are configured on a device, you are advised to specify a VLAN ID so that you can view information about a specific super VLAN.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After VLAN aggregation is configured on a device, you can determine whether VLAN aggregation has been correctly configured by running the display super-vlan command to check information about super VLANs.
When using the display super-vlan command, note the following points:
If is not specified, information about all super VLANs on the device is displayed.If is specified, information about a specific super VLAN is displayed. Before running the display super-vlan command, ensure that the device has super VLANs configured. Otherwise, no command output is displayed.
